column4: hello, can somebody help me? I'm trying to upgrade from 5.10 and everytime I run the command 'gksu "update-manager -c" ' and I enter my password it tells me I've typed a wrong password. I've retried this method a billion times and I still get the same error. What can I do to fix it??
try the command line version instead
that can happen... but i've not seen it here. The official stance is its not supported... going from clean install is best
if you forgot it, there is a way to boot up and reset it
